title: EU Consumer Rights

slides.title: The EU protects you! üá™üá∫
slides.text: The European Union is a leader in consumer protection. Knowing your rights = saving money!

slides.title: 14-Day Return üì¶
slides.text:
When buying online in the EU, you have 14 days to return items WITHOUT explanation!

This is called 'Right of Withdrawal'.

slides.question: How many days to return online purchases in EU?
slides.explanation: 14 days ‚Äî your legal right in the EU! üì¶

slides.title: Exceptions ‚ö†Ô∏è
slides.text:
14 days DON'T apply to:

‚Ä¢ Digital goods (games, music) after download
‚Ä¢ Personalized items
‚Ä¢ Perishable products
‚Ä¢ Opened hygiene products

slides.title: 2-Year Warranty! üîß
slides.text:
EU minimum warranty is 2 years.

If a product breaks due to manufacturing defect within 2 years ‚Äî seller must repair or replace FREE.

slides.question: Minimum warranty on products in EU?
slides.explanation: 2 years ‚Äî EU law! Even if seller says '1 year'. üîß

slides.title: How to return? üìù
slides.text:
1. Contact seller (email/website form)
2. Provide order number
3. Request return form
4. Ship item (sometimes you pay shipping)
5. Get refund within 14 days

slides.title: GDPR ‚Äî Data Protection üîê
slides.text:
GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) gives you the right to:

‚Ä¢ Know what data they store about you
‚Ä¢ Demand data deletion
‚Ä¢ Opt out of advertising

slides.title: Remember your rights!
slides.text: 14-day returns + 2-year warranty = your EU protection.

summary: You learned your EU rights ‚Äî 14-day returns and 2-year warranty!

title: Phishing & Scams

slides.title: Online Scammers üé£
slides.text: Phishing (from 'fishing') is when scammers 'fish' for your data using fake sites and messages.

slides.title: What does phishing look like? üìß
slides.text:
'Your account is blocked! Click here urgently...'

slides.question: What is phishing?

slides.text:
‚Ä¢ Urgency ('Immediately!', 'Last chance!')
‚Ä¢ Strange address (amaz0n.com instead of amazon.com)
‚Ä¢ Text errors

‚Ä¢ Suspicious links

slides.question: What to do if you get a suspicious link?

slides.text:

title: Passwords & 2FA
description: Why birthdate is a bad password

slides.title: Password = Key üîë
slides.text:
Your password protects:

‚Ä¢ Money on your card
‚Ä¢ Personal photos and messages
‚Ä¢ Game accounts
‚Ä¢ Social media reputation

slides.title: TOP Bad Passwords üôà
slides.text:
1. 123456
2. password
3. qwerty
4. Birthdate (01012010)
5. Name + year (john2008)
6. 111111

Hackers crack these in seconds!

slides.question: Which password is most secure?
slides.explanation: Random characters are almost impossible to crack! üîê

slides.title: How to create a strong password? üí™
slides.text:
Passphrase method:

1. Take a favorite phrase

slides.title: What is 2FA? üîê
slides.text:
2FA (Two-Factor Authentication).

1st factor: Password (what you know)
2nd factor: Code from SMS or app (what you have)

slides.question: Why use 2FA?
slides.explanation: 2FA ‚Äî a second lock on your door! üîê

slides.title: Security Rules üìã
slides.text:
1. Unique password for each site
2. Enable 2FA everywhere (especially: email, bank, social)
3. Use password manager (Bitwarden, 1Password)
4. Never share passwords!
5. Change passwords after breaches

slides.title: Check your accounts!
slides.text: Enable 2FA on all important services right now.

summary: You learned about strong passwords and 2FA ‚Äî protect your accounts!
